alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 12:44PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following areas, San Diego County Deserts and San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing heavy rain with rates of one to two inches per hour possible through this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
